definition: entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: The fourth chapter is the Zhuolu dialect entering finals.
sentences.chinese: 第四章是涿鹿方言的入聲韻母。

sentences.english: The evolution of tone IV in other dialects can also be explained in the same way.
sentences.chinese: 其他方言入聲的演變情況也可以同樣解釋。

sentences.english: Because of tone change and effect of Ningyuan Guanhua, entering tone continues to evolve.
sentences.chinese: 入聲通過連讀變調，官話的影響繼續演變。

sentences.english: Third has clarified the tendency and the pronunciation condition which the Xiakou Dialect entering toneevolves.
sentences.chinese: 第三弄清了下口話入聲演變的趨勢和語音條件。

sentences.english: Keep in mind the pronunciation of ancient characters with entering tone in putonghua.
sentences.chinese: 記住古入聲字在普通話中的讀法。

sentences.english: There are no obvious relationship between weakening of the glottal stop and the length of the tone.
sentences.chinese: 喉塞尾弱化程度與入聲時長無明顯關係。

sentences.english: The entering tone is the phoneme of remote age left in dialect.
sentences.chinese: 入聲字是上古音在方言中的遺留。

sentences.english: Glottal stop dropping is the main trend in the development of Ying dialect.
sentences.chinese: 入聲舒化是應縣方言發展的主趨勢。

sentences.english: The extinction and evolution of rushing tone in mandarin district is a very complex issue.
sentences.chinese: 入聲在官話區的消失和演變是一個很複雜的問題。

definition: the four tones of Middle Chinese: level tone 平聲|平声, rising tone 上聲|上声, departing tone 去聲|去声 and entering tone 入聲|入声/the four tones of Modern Standard Mandarin
level or even tone/first and second tones in modern Mandarin
high and level tone, the first tone of putonghua
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
falling and rising tone/third tone in modern Mandarin
falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
evenly rising tone, the second tone of putonghua
to transliterate/to transcribe/to transfer words onto a surface by direct contact (as with a decal)
tone/note/a tone (on a Chinese syllable)/CL:個|个[ge4]
